howToPlay.title: How to play Flipsies
howToPlay.gameDerived: Flipsies is a game derived from a "coin flip" or a “flip” in poker, where both you and your opponent have an equal chance at winning the hand. We added an optional side bet where you can bet on the majority color of the suits on the flop(2 or more of either red or black), this is often played in private poker games.
howToPlay.followStandart: Flipsies follows standard Texas Holdem hand rankings, these rankings are provided in the drop down menu on the upper right hand corner of the game.
howToPlay.step1: You are dealt two cards and the house also gets dealt two cards.
howToPlay.step2: Select the size of your flip bet(poker hand) and your flop color bet, there is no further betting.
howToPlay.step3: The flop(first 3 cards), turn(4th card) and river(5th card) are run out- these are the community cards.
howToPlay.step4: Whoever makes the best 5 card hand wins the flip. If it’s a draw(tie), the pot gets split equally.

question1.title: Does Flipsies offer a referral program?
question1.content: Yes, our referral program is comprised of seven levels (bronze, silver, gold, platinum, diamond, emerald and sapphire) each level is unlocked dependent on how much the referred player plays.

question2.title: Do I need to sign up for an account?
question2.content: No, although registration is recommended because of our referral program which offers incentives, signing up is not mandatory.

question3.title: What is the house edge?
question3.content: 1.5% per bet (this helps pay bills to keep the game running) .2% goes into the jackpot.

question4.title: What is provably fair?
question4.content: Most of the players think that they can be cheated on an online casino, they are right in most cases. It is, technically, very easy for an online casino to cheat you. In the crypto gambling world we have a solution called provably fair, this allows for total transparency through implementing smart contracts. Smart contracts contain a set of rules that cannot be tampered with and are automatically enforced. Any party can audit these smart contracts because they are public. Our random number generators are executed on these smart contracts which means it is technically impossible for them to be rigged, in any way.

question5.title: Is Flipsies provably fair?
question5.content: Yes, all Flipsies wagers are executed through our smart contracts on the TRON network. This ensures total transparency and fairness for all users.

mobile.1: Download TronLink mobile application for <1>IOS</1> or <3>Android</3> device.
mobile.2: Create or Import Account following the instructions.
mobile.3: Go to build-in Browser and paste https://flipsies.io/  to open Flipsies dapp.
mobile.4: Make sure you have enough TRX, bandwith and energy to start playing.

question8.title: What happens if my phone or computer gets disconnected or the battery suddenly dies?
question8.content: No need to worry, all bets can be claimed in my bet history.

question9.title: About TRON
question9.content:
Tron is a decentralized entertainment and content-sharing platform that uses blockchain and peer-to-peer (P2P) technology.

Bandwidth: Having TRON bandwidth allows you to perform transactions on the TRON mainnet without paying any gas fees. Having sufficient bandwidth is crucial when using for dApps such as Flipsies.io, where you might want to make several smaller transactions without having to worry about using your TRX tokens in the process. Bandwidth is also used to cement yourself as an active member of the TRON community, allowing you to cast votes for Super Representatives.

Energy: This is a special resource used to process smart contracts on the TRON network. Smart contracts consume Energy in addition to Bandwidth, so be sure you have enough of both when moving your tokens around.

Freezing is a unique mechanism for the Tron blockchain. You can freeze your TRX in order to gain certain benefits. When you do this, your Tron will still be yours, but you cannot send it anywhere for 3 days. Freezing is similar to putting money onto a saving account: the money is there but you cannot spent it.
When you freeze your TRX, there are several things you can gain.
First you would have to choose if you want to freeze your Tron to gain either Bandwidth points (BP)or Energy Points (EP). On top of this, for each TRX frozen you will get 1 Tron Power - no matter which of the two you choose.

flipsiesNft.title: Flipsies NFT
flipsiesNft.text1: FlipsiesNFT is a series of provably-rare NFT playing cards on the TRON blockchain, each NFT is uniquely programmatically auto-colored.
flipsiesNft.text3: 2,760 kings, 2,760 queens, 2,759 jacks, 25 jokers and 7 one-of-ones.
flipsiesNft.text4: When an NFT is staked you will have an earning rate for betting and trading on flipsies, the earning power for the NFT will be based on its rarity score. The more NFTs staked, the more you will earn.
flipsiesNft.text5: Over the years many different nicknames have been given to distinctive playing cards. Most of these bynames have came from poker games, these are several of the classic bynames that have been designated to cards.
flipsiesNft.text6: To gain access to our NFT marketplace, play-to-win or mint 1, 3 or 5 randomly generated NFTs!

kingOfHearts.title: Suicide King
kingOfHearts.label: The King of Hearts is usually depicted with a sword, although in the flipsies deck he is armed with a color changing egg. He is typically referred to as the "suicide king" because on a traditional deck he is pictured as stabbing himself with a sword, or at least holding a sword behind his head.

kingOfDiamonds.title: Man With The Axe
kingOfDiamonds.label: This designation for the King of Diamonds reflects the fact that this is the only king not carrying a sword. That is why he is often referred to as The Man With The Axe.

queenOfSpades.title: Black Widow
queenOfSpades.label: The nickname "Black Widow" for the Queen of Spades is closely connected with the game of Hearts, which is often referred to with alternative names like Black Lady, Black Maria, and Black Widow. In this trick-taking game, the idea is to avoid collecting points, with Hearts cards all worth one point each, while the Queen of Spades (sometimes dubbed "Calamity Jane" in this context) costs a massive 13 penalty points.

queenOfClubs.title: Flower Queen
queenOfClubs.label: The Queen of Clubs is known as the "Queen of flowers" or the "Flower Queen" for an obvious reason - she is usually depicted holding a Flower. Also called the "Mother Mary" card or the "Queen of Queens" this is also the most speculated card for tarot readings and other psychic beliefs.

jackOfDiamonds.title: Laughing Boy
jackOfDiamonds.label: Jacks are also called Knaves, and are inferior to the more regal Kings and Queens, making them more playful. The Jack of Diamonds is known as the Laughing Boy, and in some variations of Poker and Black Jack, players are expected to chuckle every time this card is played or drawn.

jackOfSpadesAndJackOfHearts.title: One Eyed Jacks
jackOfSpadesAndJackOfHearts.label: Unlike most of the other court cards, the Jack of Spades and the Jack of Hearts both have a side profile, hence their designation as "one-eyed Jacks".

If you reside in a location where gambling, lotteries or internet betting is illegal you must not click on anything found on this website. Flipsies- will not be held responsible for any violation of local laws enforced in your region. Flipsies games are based on fairness, transparency and fun. Players should be aware of the risks and manage themselves accordingly. Please gamble and play responsibly.
